manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Trak-4 12-Volt Capabilities Attach to any 12-Volt Asset - Trailers, Vehicles, RVs or any asset with a 12-volt power systemEmail & Text Alerts - "2:30 AM: Trailer #4 has exited the neighborhood geozone"Satellite Maps - Track many assets on one mapExtreme Battery Duration - Rechargeable internal battery lasts up to 2,000 GPS reports, even when your 12-volt asset is unpoweredGeofencing - Unlimited geozones with entry/exit email & text alertsPing Rates - Choose in-motion ping rates from 1-minute to 1-hourUSA In-House Customer Support - Actual in-factory experts assist you and answer your questions

Business Class Features REST API for GPS Reports - Use the Trak-4 service as your asset location database - very developer friendly. Full source code examples and excellent documentation are available - save time on your projects.REST API includes Webhooks for GPS Reports - Receive GPS reports in your system immediately.Unlimited Sharing - Share your device location in real-time with family, friends, and business associates.No GPS? No problem - Trak-4 will use WIFI and Cell geolocation when a GPS signal is blocked (inside garages, buildings, etc). WIFI geolocation provides great positional accuracy in populated areas.Optimized for USA - Works within the USA and features top-tier cell-network coverage.Organization-wide geozonesBulk device managementCompatible with Trak-4 Adhesive Mag KitUnlimited DataNo Contract or Activation Fees - Cancel Any Time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: GPS signal is accurate. Get notifications when trak4 has left designed geofence zones. Had issues with GPS signal trak4 going to cell triangulation but this was due to trak4 location on equipment. Moved to better location and have not lost GPS signal since. Product was easy to install and battery life has been great so far. Monthly plan is reasonably priced. Will be buying more for other equipment. Wish trak4 had an app to better manage on tablets and phones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable and Easy-to-Use GPS Tracker for Peace of Mind
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Trak-4 12v GPS Tracker for my ATV, and I must say, it has exceeded my expectations. This device is a game changer for anyone looking to keep track of their vehicles or valuable assets. From the moment I unboxed it, I was impressed by its compact size and the simplicity of its design. The setup was straightforward and hassle-free. I just connected it to my ATV battery, created an account on the web, and I was ready to go. The user interface on the web interface leaves room for improvement. It could be more robust to help justify the monthly charge. Overall, I recommend the Trak-4 12v GPS Tracker to anyone seeking a reliable and efficient way to track their vehicles or assets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This tracking device works well
reviews.reviewText: the customer support is really good, fast response. The first device i was sent was defective, hence the 4 stars, after a little bit of troubleshooting, customer support sent me another device. It works as expected. If it lasts for 6 months, i'll upgrade to 5 starsI believe this is a great layer of protection for my vehicle in addition to the car alarm and club. The subscription price is very good too. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Trucker tested and trucker UNAPPROVED
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this to track my trailer for when I drop it at meat packers for loading. They have a bad habit of not notifying drivers that trailer has been loaded. I stuck an apple tag on trailer but the update frequency wasn’t good enough along with other things so I figured I would try this tracker. It was cheap and yearly subscription was decently priced. Lots of good reviews so I figured why not. Got my tracker delivered and put it on a charger while I signed up on the website. Let it charge for a while and didn’t show up on the website. Contacted support and was told it sometimes takes a DAY for it to show up. I should have asked for a refund at this point but continued testing out. After waiting a day I was told this brand new device was not compatible with new update. Support sent me another in the mail and it arrived a week later. It was tied together with a rubber band and put in a USPS shipping bag. I didn’t really care it looked used because it was going to be hidden on trailer. After more back and forth with support I was able to get new device added to account. I paid for tracking every 10 minutes but that’s not happening. If tracker doesn’t move it will automatically go to tracking once a day. So once I stop somewhere for 30 minutes or so it switches to some kind of hibernation mode. Was told something about it was to save battery life. Being hardwired to a big car battery I don’t see why this would be an issue. Got this unit because I could hardwire it and wouldn’t need to worry about recharge it. Left my house 2 days ago to pick up a load and it pinged a few times hours after I moved. It stopped reporting where I picked up and started reporting a few time yesterday. Did the same today but stopped reporting after I was moving. Looks like it stopped a few hours ago at the stop light where I was getting back on the road. I’ve traveled almost a thousand miles in the last 2 days and it’s disappointing on how it tracks. I believe it skipped tracking me for a few states. With getting a replacement and me not being home right away to test out, I’ve gone past the point of being able to ask for a refund. Happens a lot as truck driver.Support is quick to reply but have a feel of canned messages. If you don’t really care about tracking frequency this might be for you. Even with their premium planes you will only get a ping daily if it moves. Actual tracking according to the plans have been spotty at best. Only good for when it might be stolen I guess. Will be able find if it stays in 1 location for a few days from what I’ve seen these last couple of months of using it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Tech Support + Reliable Service + Reasonable Fees = Terrific Device
reviews.reviewText: Have had a 12 vdc TRAK4 installed on a cargo trailer parked outside in the SWFL hot sun for nearly a year now and this device has never missed a report. It even reported a recent temp of 143F from its location on a "hot tin roof." Eleven solid months of SWFL exposure and that device is STILL "ticking."The website "trak-4.com" is easy to use and with 3 optional service levels, reasonably priced.Because I no longer need this trailer, I asked about selling it with the device still installed. In particular, could the buyer register the device for his own use if I provide it's key code.Gosh, I hardly send an email to tech support and a company rep got back in a few hours! Just as I hoped, all I need to do is cancel the device from my account, give the buyer its key and the new buyer can register it if he pleases.Given that the original purpose of this trailer was to transport a Harley or expensive lawn machine, I was somewhat concerned about being able to TRACK IT should it ever be stolen.Attached pictures show it installed on the trailer's roof next to solar battery charger. A small sealed 12 vdc battery was placed inside an empty "Chia Seed Jar" and strapped to the interior trailer frame. There's also a sample portion of report showing a recent movement I made with the trailer.What a terrific product.I've got two more of the devices: one wired and one rechargeable. One boat will get a wired installation in a covert location with solar recharge panel for its small discreet battery and the other will be a "Portable Pack" where I can move that unit from one vehicle to another.Gosh I'm happy with the this product and its parent company!
